title: Add milestone progress view
plan:
## Implementation Notes

Added a **Plan view** to the web UI — a third view mode (alongside List and Board) that groups tasks by milestone for planning-oriented layout with drag-and-drop to move tasks between milestones.

### Files Modified
- `web/src/hooks/useTaskFilters.ts` — Extended `ViewMode` type to include `'plan'`
- `web/src/components/toolbar/index.tsx` — Replaced Phosphor icon buttons with text labels (List / Board / Plan), removed `@phosphor-icons/react` import
- `web/src/components/toolbar/index.module.css` — Updated `.segBtn` padding/font-size for text labels
- `web/src/App.tsx` — Added `PlanView` import, `handleMilestoneChange` handler (optimistic update pattern), and conditional rendering for plan view mode

### Files Created
- `web/src/components/plan-view/index.tsx` — Plan view component using same DnD pattern as List view (`DndContext`, `PointerSensor`, `useDroppable`, `DragOverlay`). Groups tasks by milestone (sorted alphabetically, "No milestone" last). Each card has a colored status dot since tasks aren't grouped by status.
- `web/src/components/plan-view/index.module.css` — Styles based on List view layout (centered 800px groups), purple (#d2a8ff) milestone dots, `.cardRow`/`.statusDot`/`.cardWrapper` for status indicator layout.

### Key Design Decisions
- Used `__none__` sentinel string as droppable ID for the no-milestone group (maps back to empty string on drop)
- Status dots are rendered in the Plan view's card wrapper (not in shared TaskCard) to keep TaskCard unchanged
- `handleMilestoneChange` follows same optimistic-update-then-reload pattern as `handleStatusChange`
